KH.content: entire discourse on khōra, every yet-to-come history of interpretations, included in advance, this X receives all, teleologically programs history of hermeneutics[?], is that a history?
KH.linkedContent: entire discourse on khōra, every yet-to-come history of interpretations, included in advance, this X receives all, teleologically programs history of hermeneutics[?], is that a history?

GOD.content: gift of death, marriage of responsibility & faith, history depends on this excessive beginning > new experience of death
GOD.linkedContent: gift of death, marriage of responsibility & faith, history depends on this excessive beginning > new experience of death

GOD.content: this history [Christianity, Plato] will never come to a close, no history worthy of the name can be saturated or sutured
GOD.linkedContent: this history [Christianity, Plato] will never come to a close, no history worthy of the name can be saturated or sutured

GOD.content: anabasis, or “conversion,” the turns in the history of secrecy, history of revolutions, history as revolution
GOD.linkedContent: anabasis, or “conversion,” the turns in the history of secrecy, history of revolutions, history as revolution

GT.content: condition of knowing, desire to know (ēpistemē, historia rerum gestarum) [which Derrida relates to the possibility of narration], gives rise to history itself (res gestae, Geschehen, Geschichte)
GT.linkedContent: condition of knowing, desire to know (ēpistemē, historia rerum gestarum) [which Derrida relates to the possibility of narration], gives rise to history itself (res gestae, Geschehen, Geschichte)

GT.content: do Heidegger and Hegel argue the reverse? [history gives rise to narration?]
GT.linkedContent: do Heidegger and Hegel argue the reverse? [history gives rise to narration?]

GT.content: Icarus racing toward sun [via Baudelaire], sinking (sombre) not toward the bottom (fond) but toward abyss; unable to give his name, how could he ever claim he knows how to give? has no sepulture thus no proper name > the whole story? all of history?
GT.linkedContent: Icarus racing toward sun [via Baudelaire], sinking (sombre) not toward the bottom (fond) but toward abyss; unable to give his name, how could he ever claim he knows how to give? has no sepulture thus no proper name > the whole story? all of history?

FL.content: Benjamin grafted language of Marxist revolution onto messianism [see p. 263]: both announcing new historical epoch & beginning of a true history void of myth
FL.linkedContent: Benjamin grafted language of Marxist revolution onto messianism [see p. 263]: both announcing new historical epoch & beginning of a true history void of myth

HERP.content: foreign language, we know it could be intelligible, bears on beings beside which Dasein can stand, friend as stranger must belong to a Volk, engaged in a history, Mitgeschehen
HERP.linkedContent: foreign language, we know it could be intelligible, bears on beings beside which Dasein can stand, friend as stranger must belong to a Volk, engaged in a history, Mitgeschehen

OOG.content: for Husserl, not perception but history is the contrary to hallucination, imagination in general, the consciousness of historicity, reawakening of origins
OOG.linkedContent: for Husserl, not perception but history is the contrary to hallucination, imagination in general, the consciousness of historicity, reawakening of origins

OOG.content: Derrida wonders whether Husserl’s late interest in historicity, w/ genesis of geometry, would force a removal of eidetic/transcendental reductions > now that instituting facts become indispensable, invariable, sense would be indissociable from being (fact)
OOG.linkedContent: Derrida wonders whether Husserl’s late interest in historicity, w/ genesis of geometry, would force a removal of eidetic/transcendental reductions > now that instituting facts become indispensable, invariable, sense would be indissociable from being (fact)

OOG.content: but this indissociability has a rigorously determinable phenomenological sense > an iterative reduction that’s reactivating, noetic, reawakens that concealed under  secondary passivities and infinite sedimentations (different [?] from imaginary variation of static phenomenology)
OOG.linkedContent: but this indissociability has a rigorously determinable phenomenological sense > an iterative reduction that’s reactivating, noetic, reawakens that concealed under secondary passivities and infinite sedimentations (different [?] from imaginary variation of static phenomenology)

OOG.content: necessary “circle” as pure form of historical experience > return inquiry: history does not give sense to circulation of common coin, history supposes it > maintenance of circulation permits neutralization of worldly history, permits comprehension of how truth is possible
OOG.linkedContent: necessary “circle” as pure form of historical experience > return inquiry: history does not give sense to circulation of common coin, history supposes it > maintenance of circulation permits neutralization of worldly history, permits comprehension of how truth is possible

OOG.content: return inquiry [tautology]: geometry’s development is a history only because it is a history > ground of unity is the world (not finite totality of sentient beings), but infinite totality of possible experiences in space
OOG.linkedContent: return inquiry [tautology]: geometry’s development is a history only because it is a history > ground of unity is the world (not finite totality of sentient beings), but infinite totality of possible experiences in space

OOG.content: is not the interconnecting of transcendental necessities at bottom the static, structural, normative schema for conditions of history rather than history itself?
OOG.linkedContent: is not the interconnecting of transcendental necessities at bottom the static, structural, normative schema for conditions of history rather than history itself?

OOG.content: history [like creation ex nihilo] establishes the possibility of its own appearing.
OOG.linkedContent: history [like creation ex nihilo] establishes the possibility of its own appearing.

OOG.content: openness of infinite is openness of history itself, empirical history indistinguishable from nonhistory
OOG.linkedContent: openness of infinite is openness of history itself, empirical history indistinguishable from nonhistory

OOG.content: Derrida asks: why would there be any history instead of nothing?
OOG.linkedContent: Derrida asks: why would there be any history instead of nothing?

AF.content: history: domination of constative over performative
AF.linkedContent: history: domination of constative over performative

AF.content: how could someone who promises a secret to a specter still be a historian? [re: Yerushalmi]
AF.linkedContent: how could someone who promises a secret to a specter still be a historian? [re: Yerushalmi]

SPOM.content: what happens and deserves the name of an event after the end of history?
SPOM.linkedContent: what happens and deserves the name of an event after the end of history?

BL.content: law should never give rise to story > law of law: to be invested w/ categorical authority, law must have no history, genesis, no possible derivation
BL.linkedContent: law should never give rise to story > law of law: to be invested w/ categorical authority, law must have no history, genesis, no possible derivation

A.content: historians of death never ask the question “what is death?”
A.linkedContent: historians of death never ask the question “what is death?”

A.content: “culture of death”—a tautology? each culture treats death differently, w/ different partitions, culture of death = history of death (cult of ancestors, rituals of mourning/sacrifice)
A.linkedContent: “culture of death”—a tautology? each culture treats death differently, w/ different partitions, culture of death = history of death (cult of ancestors, rituals of mourning/sacrifice)

A.content: Ariès calls the “metaphysical” everything the historian must leave aside
A.linkedContent: Ariès calls the “metaphysical” everything the historian must leave aside

EM.content: hégéliano-husserliano-heideggerienne anthropology (in France) concerned itself with the concept of history but not the history of a concept, especially concerned w/ we, nous-hommes, totality of human-reality
EM.linkedContent: hégéliano-husserliano-heideggerienne anthropology (in France) concerned itself with the concept of history but not the history of a concept, especially concerned w/ we, nous-hommes, totality of human-reality

EM.content: for Hegel, Husserl, reason is history, and there is no history but of reason
EM.linkedContent: for Hegel, Husserl, reason is history, and there is no history but of reason

PP.content: the Platonic traits, mythological figures re: origin of writing > opens relation btwn mythemes & philosophemes in western logos: a history, or History, constituted by philosophical difference btwn mythos and logos
PP.linkedContent: the Platonic traits, mythological figures re: origin of writing > opens relation btwn mythemes & philosophemes in western logos: a history, or History, constituted by philosophical difference btwn mythos and logos

VM.content: acc. Levinas, no time, no history, w/out absolute alterity of each instant
VM.linkedContent: acc. Levinas, no time, no history, w/out absolute alterity of each instant

VM.content: Borges: “perhaps universal history is but the history of several metaphors,” light, for example, but what an example! which language can escape metaphor of light? [not night]
VM.linkedContent: Borges: “perhaps universal history is but the history of several metaphors,” light, for example, but what an example! which language can escape metaphor of light? [not night]

VM.content: could there be history (and work) if history did not truly meet alterity? as Levinas would have it—he does fulfill his anti-Hegelianism
VM.linkedContent: could there be history (and work) if history did not truly meet alterity? as Levinas would have it—he does fulfill his anti-Hegelianism

VM.content: for Levinas, resistance to work, by provoking it, remains a moment of the same, a finite moment that forms a system and totality w/ agent > history: laborious procession of same
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, resistance to work, by provoking it, remains a moment of the same, a finite moment that forms a system and totality w/ agent > history: laborious procession of same

VM.content: to exclude the equation God = Death would be to exclude every particular determination, but this has not been excluded by entirety of classical philosophy > God is named w/in difference btwn All and Nothing, w/in difference as difference itself > difference called history, God is inscribed in it
VM.linkedContent: to exclude the equation God = Death would be to exclude every particular determination, but this has not been excluded by entirety of classical philosophy > God is named w/in difference btwn All and Nothing, w/in difference as difference itself > difference called history, God is inscribed in it

VM.content: against Levinas, Derrida sees history as transcendence, as excess over totality, history not totality transcended by eschatology, metaphysics, speech > but these movements themselves
VM.linkedContent: against Levinas, Derrida sees history as transcendence, as excess over totality, history not totality transcended by eschatology, metaphysics, speech > but these movements themselves

VM.content: history would be meaningless, impossible w/out eschatology and transcendence, impossible as either finite totality or positive infinity
VM.linkedContent: history would be meaningless, impossible w/out eschatology and transcendence, impossible as either finite totality or positive infinity

VM.content: infinitist dogmatism in pre-Kantian style does not pose question of responsibility of finite philosopher, overlooks irreducibility of history (infinite passage through violence)
VM.linkedContent: infinitist dogmatism in pre-Kantian style does not pose question of responsibility of finite philosopher, overlooks irreducibility of history (infinite passage through violence)

VM.content: “living present” : originally and forever violent, freeing of absolute alterity in absolute same > if other can only be respected/dissimulated by the same, then time is violence, living present originally marked by death > “presence as violence is the meaning of finitude, meaning of meaning as history”
VM.linkedContent: “living present” : originally and forever violent, freeing of absolute alterity in absolute same > if other can only be respected/dissimulated by the same, then time is violence, living present originally marked by death > “presence as violence is the meaning of finitude, meaning of meaning as history”

VM.content: for Heidegger, every epoch is erring (Irren), irreducible if Being is time and history
VM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, every epoch is erring (Irren), irreducible if Being is time and history

VM.content: that language hides its own origin is not a contradiction but history itself
VM.linkedContent: that language hides its own origin is not a contradiction but history itself

VM.content: for Levinas, origin of concept must be the gift of the world to the other as tout autre, not the thought of Being
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, origin of concept must be the gift of the world to the other as tout autre, not the thought of Being

VM.content: for Levinas, despite critique of Husserl’s “anhistoricism,” origin of meaning is nonhistory, “beyond history,” a Hebraic transhistoricity? can this nonhistory be uprooted from history, can eschatology be invoked separated from every reference to history?
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, despite critique of Husserl’s “anhistoricism,” origin of meaning is nonhistory, “beyond history,” a Hebraic transhistoricity? can this nonhistory be uprooted from history, can eschatology be invoked separated from every reference to history?

VM.content: anhistoricity of meaning profoundly separates Levinas & Heidegger; for the latter, Being is history
VM.linkedContent: anhistoricity of meaning profoundly separates Levinas & Heidegger; for the latter, Being is history

VM.content: to live in difference btwn Jew and Greek, perhaps the unity we call history
VM.linkedContent: to live in difference btwn Jew and Greek, perhaps the unity we call history

VM.content: connaturality of violence & discourse as very essence of history, ethnosociological (Lévi-Strauss) information would only confirm as factual example eidetic-transcendental evidence
VM.linkedContent: connaturality of violence & discourse as very essence of history, ethnosociological (Lévi-Strauss) information would only confirm as factual example eidetic-transcendental evidence

OH.content: every history, history of a culture, has a telos (promise, memory) toward which it dreams of gathering itself > anticipation & telos; and every history cannot be identified in advance, unanticipatable, non-masterable, that of which one has no memory
OH.linkedContent: every history, history of a culture, has a telos (promise, memory) toward which it dreams of gathering itself > anticipation & telos; and every history cannot be identified in advance, unanticipatable, non-masterable, that of which one has no memory

OH.content: vis-à-vis Valéry, what has not yet happened in history: the capital event of a concept, which would be to think the event as such > the capital event is also the event of capital, the head
OH.linkedContent: vis-à-vis Valéry, what has not yet happened in history: the capital event of a concept, which would be to think the event as such > the capital event is also the event of capital, the head

OH.content: for Valéry, logos: calculation, reason, speech, discourse, knowledge > history
OH.linkedContent: for Valéry, logos: calculation, reason, speech, discourse, knowledge > history

S.content: Heidegger rephrases Hegel’s “history of spirit unfolding in time” as “the development of history falls into time”
S.linkedContent: Heidegger rephrases Hegel’s “history of spirit unfolding in time” as “the development of history falls into time”

PPHS.content: process of sign has a history, signification is history comprehended: btwn original presence & its circular reappropriation in final presence
PPHS.linkedContent: process of sign has a history, signification is history comprehended: btwn original presence & its circular reappropriation in final presence

WM.content: usure of metaphor as continuist presupposition: history of metaphor has no breaks, is not heterogenous, but incurs progressive erosion
WM.linkedContent: usure of metaphor as continuist presupposition: history of metaphor has no breaks, is not heterogenous, but incurs progressive erosion

DS.content: concept of history has lived on possibility of meaning, on past/present/promised presence of meaning & truth > outside this system, concept of history reinscribed elsewhere, strategically
DS.linkedContent: concept of history has lived on possibility of meaning, on past/present/promised presence of meaning & truth > outside this system, concept of history reinscribed elsewhere, strategically

POS.content: metaphysical concept of history, circular, linear, meaning fulfilling itself
POS.linkedContent: metaphysical concept of history, circular, linear, meaning fulfilling itself

POS.content: system of implications (teleology, eschatology, elevating & interiorizing meaning, continuity, truth, traditionality)
POS.linkedContent: system of implications (teleology, eschatology, elevating & interiorizing meaning, continuity, truth, traditionality)

P.content: for Hegel, art has a single meaning, une vérité une et nue, an etymon, that can be unveiled through history > wouldn’t this mean art is outside of history? but philosophers have always been too quick to deem art historical via opposition tekhnē/physis translated as art/nature
P.linkedContent: for Hegel, art has a single meaning, une vérité une et nue, an etymon, that can be unveiled through history > wouldn’t this mean art is outside of history? but philosophers have always been too quick to deem art historical via opposition tekhnē/physis translated as art/nature

P.content: exemplary is a singular product, cannot be imitated, an example immediately valid for all (an historical event which points to an ahistorical, the concept can only come after the blow)
P.linkedContent: exemplary is a singular product, cannot be imitated, an example immediately valid for all (an historical event which points to an ahistorical, the concept can only come after the blow)

ROP.content: new techniques of the archive threaten the concept of history
ROP.linkedContent: new techniques of the archive threaten the concept of history

SP.content: the becoming-woman (becoming Christian) of the idea, the veiling of truth, is the beginning of history, the idea s’éloigne, devient transcendante, inaccessible, séduisante, the dream of death begins (Heidegger avoids this becoming-woman in his own analysis of History of an Error)
SP.linkedContent: the becoming-woman (becoming Christian) of the idea, the veiling of truth, is the beginning of history, the idea s’éloigne, devient transcendante, inaccessible, séduisante, the dream of death begins (Heidegger avoids this becoming-woman in his own analysis of History of an Error)

ATIA.content: history, historicity, historicality, all part of auto-biography, auto-definition, auto-situation of man [re: Derrida’s hesitation to claim there’s been a historical turning point in relation btwn man and animal, figure of turning pout too genetic, biological, zoological]
ATIA.linkedContent: history, historicity, historicality, all part of auto-biography, auto-definition, auto-situation of man [re: Derrida’s hesitation to claim there’s been a historical turning point in relation btwn man and animal, figure of turning pout too genetic, biological, zoological]

ATIA.content: for Kant, a deus ex machina, a Maschinenwesen der Vorsehung (providential machine) regularizes course of history > man’s war is purposeful, has Triebfeder, unlike animal “war”
ATIA.linkedContent: for Kant, a deus ex machina, a Maschinenwesen der Vorsehung (providential machine) regularizes course of history > man’s war is purposeful, has Triebfeder, unlike animal “war”

GSP.content: acc. Husserl, Dilthey’s Weltanschauungsphilosophie is a structural historicism, doesn’t avoid relativism or skepticism: confuses truth of facts w/ truths of reason [Leibniz’s terms]
GSP.linkedContent: acc. Husserl, Dilthey’s Weltanschauungsphilosophie is a structural historicism, doesn’t avoid relativism or skepticism: confuses truth of facts w/ truths of reason [Leibniz’s terms]

GSP.content: for Husserl, pure truth missed when accounted for in historical totality, finite totality, factual totality > truth must open to infinite idea (Kant), w/out any limits, absolute, universal
GSP.linkedContent: for Husserl, pure truth missed when accounted for in historical totality, finite totality, factual totality > truth must open to infinite idea (Kant), w/out any limits, absolute, universal

GSP.content: for Husserl, a confusion of value, and all types of idealities sheltered beneath category “historical”: w/ some precautions [Derrida’s], Husserl considers Weltanschauung a “provisional morality” > system of anticipation that precedes an absolute science [a response to differance]
GSP.linkedContent: for Husserl, a confusion of value, and all types of idealities sheltered beneath category “historical”: w/ some precautions [Derrida’s], Husserl considers Weltanschauung a “provisional morality” > system of anticipation that precedes an absolute science [a response to differance]

GSP.content: radicalization of presuppositions history & psychology made phenomenology necessary

Telos/Vorhaben > infinite theoretical anticipation & infinite practical task: Kantian Idea as project of phenom.? makes it possible by overflowing its system (as its end?) > doesn’t enclose genesis of Being & meaning—is structurally genesis itself: origin/becoming, birth of history
GSP.linkedContent: Telos/Vorhaben > infinite theoretical anticipation & infinite practical task: Kantian Idea as project of phenom.? makes it possible by overflowing its system (as its end?) > doesn’t enclose genesis of Being & meaning—is structurally genesis itself: origin/becoming, birth of history

PS.content: for Foucault, enigma of the same permits continuity of meaning in absoluteness of rupture btwn madness and work > this is a historical relationship; but, for Derrida, to determine position of question (in history) is to eliminate an unexpected thought of historicity from memory
PS.linkedContent: for Foucault, enigma of the same permits continuity of meaning in absoluteness of rupture btwn madness and work > this is a historical relationship; but, for Derrida, to determine position of question (in history) is to eliminate an unexpected thought of historicity from memory

PS.content: re: Foucault, Derrida asks if fully historical field of interrogation [critical/clinical], would show us how something impossible de facto could present itself as impossible de jure [?]
PS.linkedContent: re: Foucault, Derrida asks if fully historical field of interrogation [critical/clinical], would show us how something impossible de facto could present itself as impossible de jure [?]

FS.content: “fall” of thought into philosophy, analogical displacement of Being which anchors (retient) and irremediably represses discourse in metaphysics, gets history under way (est entamée)
FS.linkedContent: “fall” of thought into philosophy, analogical displacement of Being which anchors (retient) and irremediably represses discourse in metaphysics, gets history under way (est entamée)

FS.content: difference btwn Dionysus & Apollo, ardor & structure, cannot be erased in history, because not in history > it’s an original structure, the opening of history, historicity itself
FS.linkedContent: difference btwn Dionysus & Apollo, ardor & structure, cannot be erased in history, because not in history > it’s an original structure, the opening of history, historicity itself

DPi.content: mechanism of cruelty: take (infinite) pleasure in doing evil for evil’s sake > “genealogy of morals”: theater of cruelty, history of cruelty, prehistory of history as cruelty
DPi.linkedContent: mechanism of cruelty: take (infinite) pleasure in doing evil for evil’s sake > “genealogy of morals”: theater of cruelty, history of cruelty, prehistory of history as cruelty

CHM.content: legitimate renunciation of certain style of causality must still ask etiological questions [re: “act of force”] > can a strict structuralism even write a history?
CHM.linkedContent: legitimate renunciation of certain style of causality must still ask etiological questions [re: “act of force”] > can a strict structuralism even write a history?

CHM.content: what is Descartes’ affinity w/ his historicized period?
CHM.linkedContent: what is Descartes’ affinity w/ his historicized period?

CHM.content: Freud’s latent content as danger to all historians of meaning [cf. p. 44]
CHM.linkedContent: Freud’s latent content as danger to all historians of meaning [cf. p. 44]

CHM.content: all history can only be the history of meaning
CHM.linkedContent: all history can only be the history of meaning

CHM.content: no history except of rationality/meaning: reappropriation of negativity—or forgets it (same thing) > history of truth, history of economy of negative: negativity not positive truth is the nonhistorical capital of history
CHM.linkedContent: no history except of rationality/meaning: reappropriation of negativity—or forgets it (same thing) > history of truth, history of economy of negative: negativity not positive truth is the nonhistorical capital of history

CHM.content: think an ahistoricality, negativity so negative it wouldn’t be negative > affirm negativity in silence [negative dialectics?]: access nonclassical dissociation btwn thought & language
CHM.linkedContent: think an ahistoricality, negativity so negative it wouldn’t be negative > affirm negativity in silence [negative dialectics?]: access nonclassical dissociation btwn thought & language

RGE.content: Lordship’s putting at stake of life (mettre en jeu, Daransetzen des Lebens) has meaning, it’s a moment in constitution of meaning, presentation of essence, truth
RGE.linkedContent: Lordship’s putting at stake of life (mettre en jeu, Daransetzen des Lebens) has meaning, it’s a moment in constitution of meaning, presentation of essence, truth

RGE.content: for history (that is, meaning) to form a continuous chain, to be woven (se trame), master must experience his truth (éprouve sa vérité) (must stay alive once raised above life)
RGE.linkedContent: for history (that is, meaning) to form a continuous chain, to be woven (se trame), master must experience his truth (éprouve sa vérité) (must stay alive once raised above life)

RGE.content: servile condition of mastery & entire history it makes possible > absolute privilege given to slave, truth of the master is the slave: deferred pleasure, limited stakes, delaying disappearance of thing (labor) > the condition of history/meaning/philosophy/discourse
RGE.linkedContent: servile condition of mastery & entire history it makes possible > absolute privilege given to slave, truth of the master is the slave: deferred pleasure, limited stakes, delaying disappearance of thing (labor) > the condition of history/meaning/philosophy/discourse

HLP.content: for Arendt, Derrida extrapolates, no (political) history w/out lying > Arendt sees the liar as the “man of action”
HLP.linkedContent: for Arendt, Derrida extrapolates, no (political) history w/out lying > Arendt sees the liar as the “man of action”

EJQB.content: what’s in question: the incommensurable destiny of Judaism (as birth/passion of writing) that grafts (ente) “race born of the book” onto radical origin of meaning as literality, onto historicity itself: no history sans le sérieux (gravity) and labor of literality
EJQB.linkedContent: what’s in question: the incommensurable destiny of Judaism (as birth/passion of writing) that grafts (ente) “race born of the book” onto radical origin of meaning as literality, onto historicity itself: no history sans le sérieux (gravity) and labor of literality

EJQB.content: pli douloureux de soi (painful folding of itself) par lequel l’histoire se réfléchit elle-même en se donnant le chiffre
EJQB.linkedContent: pli douloureux de soi (painful folding of itself) par lequel l’histoire se réfléchit elle-même en se donnant le chiffre

EJQB.content: history: the only thing that begins by reflecting itself > this fold, this furrow (ride), is the Jew
EJQB.linkedContent: history: the only thing that begins by reflecting itself > this fold, this furrow (ride), is the Jew

EJQB.content: Jew elects writing which elects the Jews > responsible for truth’s suffusion w/ historicity, and history’s assignment of itself (s’assigne) to its empiricity
EJQB.linkedContent: Jew elects writing which elects the Jews > responsible for truth’s suffusion w/ historicity, and history’s assignment of itself (s’assigne) to its empiricity

EJQB.content: [cf. FS p. 30 Nietzsche’s new table] breaking of Tables: rupture w/in God as origin of history
EJQB.linkedContent: [cf. FS p. 30 Nietzsche’s new table] breaking of Tables: rupture w/in God as origin of history

EJQB.content: [re: Jabès] Jew reproached by rabbinical Jews for universalism, skeletal (décharnés) allegorism, for neutralizing event in realms of symbolic/imaginary [Jew as suffering allegory]
EJQB.linkedContent: [re: Jabès] Jew reproached by rabbinical Jews for universalism, skeletal (décharnés) allegorism, for neutralizing event in realms of symbolic/imaginary [Jew as suffering allegory]

EJQB.content: Jew is split btwn 2 dimensions of letter: 1) allegory (no history, abstract universalism, cold skin of concept) 2) literality (empirical, actualized history, too warm flesh)
EJQB.linkedContent: Jew is split btwn 2 dimensions of letter: 1) allegory (no history, abstract universalism, cold skin of concept) 2) literality (empirical, actualized history, too warm flesh)

EJQB.content: is not the writing of the question, the first violence re: the question, a first response and repose, l’errance (wandering) as history, first crisis, first forgetting, the dissimulation of l’errance?
EJQB.linkedContent: is not the writing of the question, the first violence re: the question, a first response and repose, l’errance (wandering) as history, first crisis, first forgetting, the dissimulation of l’errance?

AFR.content: if there were only (natural, national) genius and progress of language—no history? > if genius is pure rupture, discontinuity, can’t be reduced to its own conditions—no history
AFR.linkedContent: if there were only (natural, national) genius and progress of language—no history? > if genius is pure rupture, discontinuity, can’t be reduced to its own conditions—no history

AFR.content: Condillac’s theory [where there is history]: imagination retraces: produces as reproduction the lost object of perception, brings to light what will have been there
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac’s theory [where there is history]: imagination retraces: produces as reproduction the lost object of perception, brings to light what will have been there

AFR.content: for Condillac, there is no difference in general, only of degrees > this proposition comes to unfold (déplier) all concepts of rupture/repetition, this unfolding is time’s
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, there is no difference in general, only of degrees > this proposition comes to unfold (déplier) all concepts of rupture/repetition, this unfolding is time’s

IW.content: history’s harshest reality, its most murderous aspects—displacements of figures?
IW.linkedContent: history’s harshest reality, its most murderous aspects—displacements of figures?

IW.content: [vis-à-vis Rosenzweig] “unheard-of” singularity of Jewish nation: its birth belongs to (God’s) Law, not to nature > inscribed in a history that began before it was born (though it was already its own)—history of this nation: supernatural, transhistorical, prehistoric
IW.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Rosenzweig] “unheard-of” singularity of Jewish nation: its birth belongs to (God’s) Law, not to nature > inscribed in a history that began before it was born (though it was already its own)—history of this nation: supernatural, transhistorical, prehistoric

EL.content: for Heidegger & Scholem, when a “sign” regains its sacredness, history takes revenge [?]
EL.linkedContent: for Heidegger & Scholem, when a “sign” regains its sacredness, history takes revenge [?]

TN.content: there can only be a figure of touch, one only touches by way of figure > the object, the touchable thing, the "thing itself,” is the untouchable (gives itself, opens only in history of figure)
TN.linkedContent: there can only be a figure of touch, one only touches by way of figure > the object, the touchable thing, the "thing itself,” is the untouchable (gives itself, opens only in history of figure)

WOG.content: unity of history of metaphysics a domestic representation (economic reappropriation)

khōra, utterly resistant to historical narrative, not eternal or ahistorical like intelligible idea > radically foreign to all oppositions & heterogenous to epekeina tēs ousias (the one that doesn’t participate in Being, gives rise to history, narratives, myths, Good and God)

BSi.content: Freud speaks of an a-historical stasis of animals due to equilibrium btwn drives/environment [bees have a prehistory?]: mankind an irruption of destructive instinct [as history?]
BSi.linkedContent: Freud speaks of an a-historical stasis of animals due to equilibrium btwn drives/environment [bees have a prehistory?]: mankind an irruption of destructive instinct [as history?]

OG.content: history and knowledge (istoria and epistémè) > detours for the purpose of (en vue de) reappropriating presence
OG.linkedContent: history and knowledge (istoria and epistémè) > detours for the purpose of (en vue de) reappropriating presence

OG.content: metaphysics rethinks/conceals supplementarity as accomplishment of dynamis/virtuality, substituting pure history for pure play > supplement permits & escapes this thought
OG.linkedContent: metaphysics rethinks/conceals supplementarity as accomplishment of dynamis/virtuality, substituting pure history for pure play > supplement permits & escapes this thought

OG.content: history of knowledge as desacralizaiton of signifier: history only conceivable btwn absolute pictograph & graphic expense reduced to presque rien

EU.content: [in truth, since Descartes sees universal language as impossible] humans are btwn paradise of absolutely natural language & romance of universal transparency: this fall is history
EU.linkedContent: [in truth, since Descartes sees universal language as impossible] humans are btwn paradise of absolutely natural language & romance of universal transparency: this fall is history

EU.content: romance of universal language cannot tell a true story [i.e. is not history]
EU.linkedContent: romance of universal language cannot tell a true story [i.e. is not history]

EU.content: for Kant, historical imitation, mnemotechnics, not inventive production of reason [Leibnizian motif: sees reason as ahistorical]
EU.linkedContent: for Kant, historical imitation, mnemotechnics, not inventive production of reason [Leibnizian motif: sees reason as ahistorical]

EU.content: for Schelling, individuals, who are finite, must translate > if mind could simply be infinite, there’d be no need to translate > “originary knowledge” can become “real" in an individual, only in der Gattung (in the genus), i.e. in historical institutions > history: becoming-real of idea
